intro: Siphocampylus funckeanus var. subcanus, commonly known as the silky siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
